definitions.definition: a single step taken when walking or running.
examples: step, stride he stepped back a pace

definitions.definition: a unit of length representing the distance between two successive steps in walking.
a gait of a horse or other animal, especially one of the recognized trained gaits of a horse.
a person's manner of walking or running.
consistent and continuous speed in walking, running, or moving.
examples: most traffic moved at the pace of the riverboat
synonyms: lick "he drove home at a furious pace"

definitions.definition: the speed or rate at which something happens, changes, or develops.
examples: the children work separately in the classroom at their own pace

definitions.definition: walk at a steady and consistent speed, especially back and forth and as an expression of one's anxiety or annoyance.
examples: we paced up and down in exasperation

definitions.definition: measure (a distance) by walking it and counting the number of steps taken.
examples: I paced out the dimensions of my new home

definitions.definition: lead (another runner in a race) in order to establish a competitive speed.
examples: Morales paced us for four miles

definitions.definition: do something at a slow and steady rate or speed in order to avoid overexerting oneself.
examples: Frank was pacing himself for the long night and day ahead

definitions.definition: move or develop (something) at a particular rate or speed.
examples: the action is paced to the beat of a perky march

definitions.definition: (of a horse) move in a distinctive lateral gait in which both legs on the same side are lifted together, seen mostly in specially bred or trained horses.
